item.dc:creator: @relexlawl relexlawl
item.description:
@relexlawl wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:39, topic:507227”][quote author=relexlawl link=topic=625457.msg4261382#msg4261382 date=1363488203]

What? When I handled my commands with hashmaps before (I’m sure you remember), he told me to remove it and explained why. He told me that while he was explaining.

then he’s stupid

I wouldn’t use hashmaps for commands…I don’t really categorize myself as stupid

I guess it depends on his reasoning.
[/quote]
the reason why he doesn’t want to use a hashmap is stupid[/quote]

Well what’s the reason?

item.title: A better way to handle commands
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:33, topic:507227”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=625457.msg4260877#msg4260877 date=1363448378]
Advice I was told: “Hashmaps would be used to handle things that count up probably to the thousands.” - AtomicInt_
[/quote]
Ryley wouldn’t say that… hashmaps shouldn’t be used to handle things that require a lot of input. I believe cause of the overhead and memory usage but correct me if I’m wrong :D[/quote]
What? When I handled my commands with hashmaps before (I’m sure you remember), he told me to remove it and explained why. He told me that while he was explaining.

Read full topic
item.source: A better way to handle commands

item.title: A better way to handle commands
item.dc:creator: @relexlawl relexlawl
item.description:
@relexlawl wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:33, topic:507227”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=625457.msg4260877#msg4260877 date=1363448378]
Advice I was told: “Hashmaps would be used to handle things that count up probably to the thousands.” - AtomicInt_
[/quote]
Ryley wouldn’t say that… hashmaps shouldn’t be used to handle things that require a lot of input. I believe cause of the overhead and memory usage but correct me if I’m wrong :D[/quote]

(hash)maps should be used for it’s purpose…Which is to store a value according to it’s key, so you can retrieve it later on…As to where, if you use a list, you could only retrieve it according to it’s order.

Just using a list as an example of when it’s appropriate to use a map over other things.

Read full topic

item.title: A better way to handle commands
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

arham 4:

Advice I was told: “Hashmaps would be used to handle things that count up probably to the thousands.” - AtomicInt_

Ryley wouldn’t say that… hashmaps shouldn’t be used to handle things that require a lot of input. I believe cause of the overhead and memory usage but correct me if I’m wrong

HcoJustin:

It is just a different way of doing things. It sides more with the OO approach, but really doesn’t matter what you decide to do

Thanks for clearing that up

Read full topic

item.title: A better way to handle commands
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:24, topic:507227”][quote author=Clawz fury link=topic=625457.msg4260491#msg4260491 date=1363412250]

What’s up with the comment about making an array handle commands?..

lol, idk

but looking back on this I’m thinking maybe I should have stuck with the more simple way of doing things. I wonder why blake (I can’t remember if it was blake, but it was somebody with the java guru status) would say to use a hashmap to handle commands then. hm.
[/quote]
It is just a different way of doing things. It sides more with the OO approach, but really doesn’t matter what you decide to do[/quote]

item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:20, topic:507227”]@Arham: Yes, that’s what I meant. Not much of a difference, but in the end it makes for an overall better layout.

Actually, switches can deal with strings :o

Isn’t that a new feature with java 1.7?

Java 7 was released over a year and a half ago, mang…[/quote]

and i’ve been gone most of that year and a half ago.

item.title: A better way to handle commands
item.dc:creator: @relexlawl relexlawl
item.description:
@relexlawl wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:22, topic:507227”][quote author=relexlawl link=topic=625457.msg4260486#msg4260486 date=1363411833]
What’s up with the comment about making an array handle commands?..
[/quote]
lol, idk

but looking back on this I’m thinking maybe I should have stuck with the more simple way of doing things. I wonder why blake (I can’t remember if it was blake, but it was somebody with the java guru status) would say to use a hashmap to handle commands then. hm.[/quote]

Pretty sure blake follows the KISS analogy

Read full topic
item.source: A better way to handle commands

item.title: A better way to handle commands
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:22, topic:507227”][quote author=relexlawl link=topic=625457.msg4260486#msg4260486 date=1363411833]
What’s up with the comment about making an array handle commands?..
[/quote]
lol, idk

but looking back on this I’m thinking maybe I should have stuck with the more simple way of doing things. I wonder why blake (I can’t remember if it was blake, but it was somebody with the java guru status) would say to use a hashmap to handle commands then. hm.[/quote]

Most frameworks released so far use HashMap. But if you’re going to have a large amount of commands for debugging and such then you might as well just use a collection compared to having only a few commands which could just use the if statement way.

Read full topic
